1. 1.	If 16 infants with **no genuine preference** choose 16 toys, what is the most likely number of "helping" toys that will be chosen?[^1]
   (a)	4
   (b)	7
   (c)	8
   (d)	9
   (e)	10


[^1]:  c.	8

---

2. Why do we use a t distribution (instead of a z / normal distribution) in the t-test?[^2]
   a. the technical conditions don’t hold
   b. the means are quite variable
   c. we like the letter t
   d. we have two samples
   e. we don’t know the true standard deviation parameter

[^2]:  e. we don’t know the true standard deviation parameter
